title: Lowys sell $815m stake in Scentre Group via UBS
text:
The Lowy family has sold its stake in Australian shopping centre owner Scentre Group, as first reported by Street Talk.

Stockbroker UBS handled a trade of 206 million shares in Scentre Group on Wednesday night.

While it is not known who UBS sold the shares for, fund managers were quick to point to the Lowy family.

Boss move: UBS blocked out the Lowy family's remaining stake in Scentre Group on Wednesday night. Photo: Rob Homer

UBS was offering the shares to fund managers at $3.956 a share. The deal was soon covered by a small handful of existing and new shareholders, sources said.

The stock closed at $4.01 on Wednesday. The trade was at a 1.3 per cent discount to the last close.
